Description: Body fragment of Attic black-figured pottery closed vase, probably a lekythos. Woman to right with perhaps drapery of another figure behind her; in front of her a large, curving object; added white for her flesh and added red for part of her skirt and for the object in front of her.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit suggests the curving object is a shield, but it is not round; its proximity to the female is curious.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 81 no. 271 pl. 61)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1927)
